verb.description: Walk in an awkward way, typically because of pain from an injury.
examples: he was hobbling around on crutches

verb.description: Tie or strap together (the legs of a horse or other animal) to prevent it from straying.

noun.description: An awkward way of walking, typically due to pain from an injury.
examples: he finished the game almost reduced to a hobble

noun.description: A rope or strap used for hobbling a horse or other animal.

origin: Middle English: probably of Dutch or Low German origin and related to Dutch hobbelen rock from side to side. hobble (sense 2 of the verb) is a variant of hopple.
